org.codehaus.preon
Interface Builder

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultBuilder
public interface Builder

The interface to be implemented by objects with the capability to create default instances of arbitrary types being passed in. This interface was introduced to allow Codecs to create instances of a certain type without having to worry on how these instances need to be constructed.

This is needed in particular when the Codecs need to create instances of (non-static) inner classes. In those cases, the new instances need to be constructed by passing a reference to the outer instance. Since Codecs are not aware of the outer instance, they would never be able to create instances of the inner class. By introducing the Builder we are able to pass in a context from the owning Codec with the capability to create instances of inner classes.

Author:
Wilfred Springer

Method Summary
<T> T
create(Class<T> type)
          Creates a default instance of T.
 

Method Detail

create

<T> T create(Class<T> type)
         throws InstantiationException,
                IllegalAccessException
Creates a default instance of T.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of instance we need.
Parameters:
type - The type of instance desired.
Returns:
An instance of T.
Throws:
InstantiationException - If we can't instantiate the given type.
IllegalAccessException - If we are not allowed to instantiate the given type.
